blog.name: doublehex
blog.title: Doublehex
blog.description: I write GOT fanfics. Send help. Also a Hugo nominated author (along with the rest of AO3).

summary: So by now, all of the Daenerys Targaryen fandom has come to the conclusion that Drogon will be bringing her body to Kinvara to...
body:
So by now, all of the Daenerys Targaryen fandom has come to the conclusion that Drogon will be bringing her body to Kinvara to be resurrected. There already has been so many parallels between these two characters, I see no reason as to why they can’t have this. I don’t disagree with this. It makes thematic sense.

What I do not agree on is what happens next. Many want to see Daenerys burn everything. Have Drogon come back every year and put Winterfell and King’s Landing to the ground. And I get why that sentiment exists. Daenerys was given the most raw of raw deals this season. Her heel turn made no sense with her character. It was one of the most gross displays of misogyny, xenophobia, ableism and victim blaming I have seen in modern storytelling.

And her death scene was even worse. Much and plenty has been said on that, so I won’t waste space here.

I do not want Daenerys to be filled with vengeance when she gets revived. I want to see a path of reconciliation for her. One of the powers of fiction, and indeed something that I love about the Fantasy genre as a whole, is the power of forgiveness and redemption.

We do not like what D&D did to Daenerys. What she did in “The Bells” was as Out-of-Character as a character can act. I am not defending that. But if we are going to have a “What happens after 8x06″ we NEED to deal with that. And it was that the Targaryen madness DID overwhelm Daenerys in that moment. It it is the only way it makes any sense.

And Daenerys is revived, and I want to say the taint is no longer there. Daenerys is forced to face what she did. There is no sugar coating it. She cannot pretend it was for the greater good, or she can’t rule with small mercies, or any of that bullshit. She went against all of her values and beliefs.

Daenerys needs to ask herself WHY the Lord of Light brought her back, why he is not done with her. And I think the answer can be found in her speech in 8x06. There is still slavery in the world. And she has to be the one to end it.

But ultimately, this Daenerys needs to be the one we saw in 8x03. A rescuer, a savior, someone who is horrified by what she did. She was consumed by madness. That is the only explanation. She must find atonement - and the only way she can do that is by ending slavery for good.

I would say the first major arc has to be all about Daenerys. Jon is not even a major character. She is regathering her allies, forming a new coalition of Unsullied, Dothraki, R’hllor zealots and sellswords. And she goes to war against the Free Cities.

Daenerys is not a conqueror. She is a liberator. And she has to come to terms with that. Let this be her path of redemption.

And of course, Jon will hear of it. It is narratively unfulfilling if he doesn’t. He hears of what she is doing, but he only hears shards and fragments of it. But all he knows is that the woman that murdered hundreds of thousands of innocents is back, alive, with a dragon, and seemingly doing the same thing to the Free Cities.

So of course he goes to Essos. He has to stop her. For good;

But, of course, we know that isn’t how it works out. There is reconciliation. There is peace found between them. There is redemption.

Because why bother trying to do better when you can’t find forgiveness?

summary: *Dany addressing her people in Kings Landing telling them about how she wants to “break the wheel”...and yet she’s dressed in...
body:
*Dany addressing her people in Kings Landing telling them about how she wants to “break the wheel”…and yet she’s dressed in all black looking like a cult leader/dictator telling them that the “war” is not over until they’ve taken over every land and killed anyone who stands in their way

Tyrion, Jon, and Arya looking around like…

blog.name: kingjjon
blog.title: don't you dare go hollow
blog.description: jonsa // probably crying over Jon Snow right now // Mordor resident

tags: there it is - jon snow depression hous
summary: Why was Jaime pardoned for killing Aerys before he did anything but Jon wasn't for killing a mass murderer? I'm fine with Jon...
question: Why was Jaime pardoned for killing Aerys before he did anything but Jon wasn't for killing a mass murderer? I'm fine with Jon not being King after what happened because I doubt people would want a Targ as King after all that but it makes no sense to me that he'd be exiled. I also assumed he was leaving to go Beyond the Wall to be King like Mance or even just to live as one of the Free Folk but read an article where they said Jon would be staying at Castle Black :/
answer:
That’s so sad, right? And Jaime’s got Brienne who wrote down all his good deeds to make sure he will be remembered as a better man, she did this despite her broken heart. But Jon, who saved the world twice is exiled and forced to take that stupid oath again! He’s back to being a bastard with no name, no family, with nothing to inherit. No one even thanked him for all that he did for Westeros. I’m mostly okay with him not being king, but he doesn’t even get to be Jon Stark which is what he wanted all this life, how unfair is that??1 o my heart

But idk about him staying at Castle Black, to be honest. No one knows how the Nights Watch functions now and if it even is anything more than just a prison. Wanna be sad with me for a moment?

The chill was always with him here. In a few years he would forget what it felt like to be warm.

- AGOT Jon III

This is his reward for saving the world from ice and fire. Thanks, I hate it.

On the other hand, him staying at Castle Black means he’s able to stay in touch with Sansa, and it’s easier for her to find him to drag his ass back home after she pardons him.

This is his reward for saving the world from ice and fire. Thanks, I hate it.

On the other hand, him staying at Castle Black means he’s able to stay in touch with Sansa, and it’s easier for her to find him to drag his ass back home after she pardons him.

summary: Jon's "pain" by killing Daenerys is not the same when Tyrion killed Shae.
body:
Jon’s “pain” by killing Daenerys is not the same when Tyrion killed Shae.

Shae was at the mercy of powerful people. She was just a whore, a nobody and at some extent, Tyrion owned her. While Jon was the submissive in the relationship with Dany. It was her who kept threatening and questioning his family and friends (Sansa, Bran and Sam). It was her who put him an ultimatum to keep his secret, denied his parentage and isolated him from his family. She IS the powerful one of the room (literally), and she even tried to manipulate him emotionally. She victim blamed Sansa, put Jon in danger and envies both of them. The power imbalance is at her favor, not in Jon, the man. Therefore, there is no mysoginy if the woman is the abuser.

And the fact that they forced him to cry over a MASS MURDERER to have a less impact on the controversy, it means that society still has to understand that mysoginy, sexism and gender violence, is harmful for men too, not just women.

Kit spoke about this, and I’m so glad that he didn’t just accept it and became a lapdog for faux feminism. His character may have been assassinated for a sad death of his beloved not really mass murderer girl, but his ideals and opinion stand as strong as ever. He didn’t bend the knee to Dany’s faux feminism, and I STAN HIM FOR IT!

summary: I’m pretty sure the last episode of GoT was just to set up spin-offs
body:
I’m pretty sure the last episode of GoT was just to set up spin-offs

The adventures of Jon Snow “North of The Wall”

The adventures of Arya “West of Westeros”

The adventures of Bran “The King and the Dragon”

The wardrobe department of Sansa “Queen in the North”
